description: This course follows French history from the time of the Franco-Prussian War to the start of the new millennium. We will examine the French rivalry with Germany in the modern period, as well as significant moments in the history of the Republic such as the Boulanger Affair and the Dreyful Affair. Special attentionwill be paid to France in the era of the two World Wars, with particular focus on the Vichy regime in occupoed France and the legacy of this government in France today. Our discussion continues with post-war history in topics such as Americanization, the Algerian War, decolonization, and immigration in France today. This course is an introductory course and the second in a sequence, but may be taken separately and does not assume prior knowledge of French History.
name: FRANCE SINCE 1870: FRANCE-1870 TO PRESENT
